original: Hallberg, Per August Emrl, tandläkare, Göteborg, f. 13/1/91 i Morup, Hall. il., av godsäg. Algot H. o. Lotten Löndahl. G. 35 m. Gudrun Rosen-crantz. Barn: Vibeke Margareta f. 36, Birgitta Charlotta Persdotter 37. — Stud:ex. i Skara 10, res :off :ex. 13, stud. v. vet:högsk. 13-16, Cand. med. dent. i Greifswald 23, tysk tandläk. där 25 o. Dr. med. dent. 28, sv. tand- läk. 29. Und :löjtn. i Livreg. hus. res. 13, löjtn. 17, avs’k. 23. Konsulatsekr. i Tyskl. 16-19. Statsanst. lär. v. Greifs-walds univ. tandil :inst. 25-28, praktik i Falkenberg 29-33, i Ätran m. bipraktik i Ullared o. Vessigebro, distr:tandl. i Marstrand 40-42, praktik i Lidköp. 45-46 o. i Gbg sed. 46. Ordf. i Skand. stud: för en. i Greifswald 22-24, i Fa|lkenbergs skyttefören. 29-32, v. ordf. i Falkenbergs iandst :fören. 30-31. Kom-m:ful’lm. i Ätran. Skr.: über die Er-zeug. und Bedeut. der künstl. Zahn-karies (grad:avh.), art. i genealogi m. m. samt dikter. Hobbies: utöv. konstn. o. dikt. NyaSvM, TyskMM, ÖUngRKOffHtakl, FdaCO.
translated: Hallberg, Per August Emrl, Dentist, Gothenburg, born January 13th, 1891 in Morup, Halland County, the son of estate owner Algot H. and Lotten Löndahl. He married Gudrun Rosencrantz in 1935 and they had two children: Vibeke Margareta, born in 1936, and Birgitta Charlotta Persdotter, born in 1937. He passed his studentexamen (school-leaving examination) in Skara in 1910, became a reserve officer in 1913, studied at the Veterinary College from 1913-1916, graduated with a degree in dental medicine in Greifswald in 1923, became a licensed German dentist in 1925, earned his Doctor of Dental Medicine in 1928, and a Swedish dental license in 1929. He served as under-lieutenant in the Livregementets husar and lieutenant in 1917, retiring in 1923. He was the consulate secretary in Germany from 1916-1919, a faculty member of the University of Greifswald Dental Institute from 1925-1928, worked in Falkenberg from 1929-1933, including at Ullared and Vessigebro, was a district dentist in Marstrand from 1940-1942, worked in Lidköping in 1945-1946, and has worked in Gothenburg since 1946. He served as chairman of the Scandinavian Student Association in Greifswald from 1922-1924, chairman of the Falkenbergs Shooting Association from 1929-1932, and vice chairman of the Falkenbergs Dental Association from 1930-1931. He served as a deputy municipal commissioner in Ätran. He has written about the production and significance of artificial tooth decay, genealogy and other topics, and is interested in visual art and poetry. His works have been published in NyaSvM, TyskMM, ÖUngRKOffHtakl, FdaCO.
